brief:
# Market Brief - February 25, 2026

## KEY MARKET MOVERS
• **Technology leads broad-based rally**: Snowflake (+5.07%) and Palantir (+4.57%) drove tech sector gains of +2.00%, with enterprise software companies benefiting from continued AI infrastructure spending momentum
• **Healthcare mixed signals**: UnitedHealth surged +3.05% on strong managed care fundamentals, while Eli Lilly declined -0.85% as investors took profits following recent biotech outperformance
• **Consumer defensive weakness**: Walmart (-0.53%) and Costco (-0.68%) pressured the defensive sector (-0.55%), suggesting renewed risk appetite as investors rotate out of safety plays
• **Microsoft maintains momentum**: MSFT gained +2.44% to $398.48, approaching the psychological $400 level on continued cloud and AI tailwinds
• **Energy sector lags**: Chevron's -0.73% decline contributed to energy's -0.62% underperformance, reflecting ongoing concerns about demand outlook

## GEOPOLITICAL & MACRO
• **Domestic market focus**: Limited headline flow suggests investors are concentrating on corporate fundamentals and sector rotation dynamics rather than external catalysts
• **Risk-on sentiment prevails**: The rotation from defensive sectors into technology and financials indicates growing investor confidence in economic resilience

## SECTOR ANALYSIS
• **Growth outperforms value**: Technology's +2.00% leadership versus consumer defensive's -0.55% decline signals a clear growth-oriented rotation pattern
• **Financial services momentum**: The +1.12% gain in financials suggests continued optimism around interest rate environment and credit conditions
• **Cyclical strength**: Consumer cyclical (+0.78%) outpacing defensive sectors reinforces the risk-on theme across equity markets

## WHAT MATTERS TODAY
Markets are displaying healthy risk appetite with technology-led gains and defensive sector rotation, suggesting underlying economic confidence. Key levels to monitor: S&P 500 holding above 690 support and Microsoft's approach to the $400 milestone.
